definition: to ask sb to stay/to keep sb for the night/to await (classical)
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Retain the most memorable kiss, kissing the man failed to keep.
sentences.chinese: 留住了最刻骨銘心的吻，留不住接吻的那個人。

sentences.english: ShangHeng saw her carrying luggage, managed to keep her.
sentences.chinese: 尚恆看見她帶着行李，設法留住她。

sentences.english: As a kind of oil, it is surprisingly water-soluble and can be thoroughly wash off with water.
sentences.chinese: 沒有緊繃感，並能留住滋潤，讓洗臉也變成一種享受。

sentences.english: We have to retain our best customer. We have to be there.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須獲得那份銷售合同，留住最好的客戶。

sentences.english: A great recommendation system can retain and attract users to the service.
sentences.chinese: 一個好的推薦系統能夠爲這項服務留住並且吸引用戶。

sentences.english: After jalam injury and have to be apart, can reach wei forced to keep her.
sentences.chinese: 雅蘭傷好後又要分開，可達偉強行留住了她。

sentences.english: Keeping current club members is just as important as bringing in new ones, Dochterman said.
sentences.chinese: 留住現有的社員與引進新社員同等重要，陶德曼說。

sentences.english: Step away from that cookie if you want to keep your boyfriend, ladies.
sentences.chinese: 女人們，要想留住自己的男朋友，就離小甜餅遠點吧。

sentences.english: Boxed and terraced planters retain more root moister and nutrients.
sentences.chinese: 盒裝和梯田種植留住更多的根潮溼和養分。

sentences.english: From that day Saul kept David with him and did not let him return to his father's house.
sentences.chinese: 那日掃羅留住大衛，不容他再回父家。

sentences.english: For some reason, I can not condone my own to keep you.
sentences.chinese: 爲了某種原因，我不能緃容自己留住你。

sentences.english: Thus, by the relationship between the people always retain the Xiasheng down.
sentences.chinese: 由此可見，靠關係留住人始終都是落了下乘。

sentences.english: Learn to give up some dreams wished to keep.
sentences.chinese: 學會放棄時有些夢希望能留住。

sentences.english: The abdominal ability tarry that still is an evenness is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 還是一個平坦的腹部才能留住漂亮。

sentences.english: Grab your gun and fire into them. You keep one next the bed for this very reason?
sentences.chinese: 抄起你的槍向他射擊，留住他的命在在牀邊問他緣由？

sentences.english: Can London keep these young people in London with enough funding and advise.
sentences.chinese: 倫敦真能用足夠的資金和遊說留住這些年輕人嗎？

definition: to want to/to feel like/to fancy/to care for sb/desirous of
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
to leave behind/to stay behind/to remain/to keep/not to let (sb) go
